intro: Mediocalcar paradoxum subsp. paradoxum, commonly known as the paradoxum subshrub, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, aiding in water retention. The flowers bloom in shades of yellow to orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
